etymology.description: 女(女) (nǚ, "woman") + 兆(兆) (zhào, phonetic) = semantic component 'woman' with phonetic 'zhào' -> used as a clan name and surname -> denotes 'handsome; elegant'
etymology.interpretation: The character 姚(yáo) conveys elegance by combining the semantic element 女(女) (nǚ, "woman") with the phonetic element 兆(兆) (zhào), indicating that this term historically relates to qualities associated with women, later extended to mean 'handsome' or 'elegant.'

examples.chinese: 他不仅外貌姚(他不僅外貌姚)，气质也姚(氣質也姚)。
examples.pinyin: tā bù jǐn wàimào yáo, qìzhì yě yáo.
examples.english: Not only does he have a handsome appearance, but his temperament is also elegant.
